page.title: 17THE PLAZA ROMSEY
page.content: The Plaza was saved and renovated by Romsey Amateur Dramatic Society and re-opened as a theatre on 3rd January 1984 by Lord Romsey. It had been a cinema, then a bingo hall and very nearly became a guest house! Romsey is very proud to have its own theatre, and helped raise the Â£140,000 needed. It costs about Â£40 a day to run the building so RAODS need lots of people to visit the theatre instead of watching television! Come on tour to see what it's like. In the small foyer is the box office and refreshments stall. On each side a flight of stairs leading up to what was once the old "circle". Look up at the enormous light towering overhead and the delicate glass emergency lights. They all date back to 1931 when the Plaza was built.
